meanings.definition: Apply a new coat of varnish to (something).
meanings.sent1: I will be revarnishing the old table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys revarnishing furniture as a hobby.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy painter kept revarnishing the same spot by mistake.
meanings.sent4: Revarnishing the memories of the past can bring new life to them.
meanings.sent5: The sun revarnishing the sky with vibrant colors at dawn is a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: The action of applying a new coat of varnish to something.
meanings.sent1: The revarnishing of the wooden floor was a time-consuming task.
meanings.sent2: He learned about the importance of revarnishing from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The revarnishing of the park benches made them look brand new.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a revarnishing, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The revarnishing of the boat gave it a fresh and polished appearance.
